She is taking a loan of 2000 sdg to purchase pawpaw, eggs, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. In 5 years Keje would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Keje says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like pawpaw, eggs, etc

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marcelina works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle repair shop business in the Philippines. Marcelina is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her business.

Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Mwanzanje

texts.en:
Mwanzanje lives with his wife and their son in a family home. He has been running a charcoal store for several years with his wife, who helps him attend to the clients. They work in the store from Monday to Sunday.

With this loan, he hopes to invest in the purchase of more sacks of charcoal to grow his business. This will help him to increase his sale possibilities and better serve his clients.

His goal is to have a better income through his business, so that he can help his family move forward.

loans.use: purchase of more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mahudjro 4 Group

texts.fr: MAHUDJRO 4 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Fifamè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Fifamè est mère d’un enfant vivant à la charge du couple. Fifamè vit seule avec son unique enfant. Fifamè n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Fifamè mène comme activité la vente de divers articles et des lubrifiants dans un quartier du Bénin. Fifamè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Fifamè s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Fifamè sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 4. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The Mahudjro 4 Group is made up of three friends who all live in the same quarter.  The representative of the group, Fifamè (with her hand raised in the photo), is 38 years old and no longer lives with her husband.  Fifamè has one child who is a dependent of the couple. Fifamè lives alone together with her only child. 

Fifamè has never been to school.  For about ten years, Fifamè has run a profit-generating activity selling a range of products and lubricants in an area of Benin.  Fifamè is passionate about her business, which allows her to support herself and her child.  Fifamè buys her supplies in her locale. 

In the hopes of better satisfying her clientele, Fifamè is asking for her first loan along with the other members of the Mahudjro 4 Group.  This loan will enable them to better respond to the demands of their clientele and generate higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase various articles.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Marissa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anselim

texts.en:
Anselim is a 39-year-old farmer in Nkubu County, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and one child, who is in school. He has been in farming for eight years. He produces coffee, bananas, maize, and beans, which he sells locally. He also runs a retail shop and has a motorbike business as additional sources of income. 

He is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase irrigation equipment to help improve his production, which will increase his income from selling the the produce and enable him to pay his child's school fees.

Poor weather conditions are his main challenge in farming. He aspires to be a prominent farmer in the future.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's faster way of processing loans.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en: Ariunaa is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Chuluunsuh, has been helping his wife take care of livestock. Her daughter is a university student, her older son goes to the secondary school and her younger son stays at home. Ariunaa started her organic dairy products business in 2008. Now, her business is stable and she has built closer relationships with many customers. She is preparing her cattle to survive through long, harsh Mongolian winter. She needs 3,000,000 MNT to purchase forage and grass to feed her cattle during the winter. She says that "I want to expand my business by increasing the number of cattle and production of organic dairy products."

loans.use: To purchase forage and grass to feed her cattle during the winter.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothing retail business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from general store and manicure/pedicure services. Marites is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a farmer from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol. She is growing rice in their farm lot. She has two children and her husband works as a farmer and as a carpenter.

Marites is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice. With this, she will be able to grow and produce a good quality crop.

In the future, Marites wants to expand her business and saves money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice

loans.name: Oklunon Lingbotoche Group

texts.fr: OKLUNON LINGBOTOCHE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Suzanne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans et est marié  à un certain André. Suzanne est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Suzanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a près de trois ans que Suzanne vend divers produits à son domicile. Suzanne mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Suzanne sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe OKLUNON LINGBOTOCHE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Oklunon Lingbotoche is a group made up of three people living in the same area of Benin.  The representative of the group, Suzanne (with her hand raised in the photo), is 42 years old and married to a man named André.  Suzanne is the mother of three children, all of whom attend school and are dependents of the couple.  Suzanne lives together with her husband and children, and works together with her husband to provide for the many family expenses.

For almost three years, Suzanne has been selling a range of products out of her home.  Suzanne does this business to provide for the needs of the household.  She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of satisfying her customers, Suzanne is asking for a third loan along with the other members of the Oklunon Lingbotoche.  This loan will enable them to better respond to the demands of their clientele, and therefore generate higher profits.  The previously issued loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase various products.

loans.name: Les Refferances De Bordemer 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Bazile est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Refferances de Bordemer 4, 5 & 6. Il est un commercant et  habite dans la région  DE BOR DE MER  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Bazile voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les divers produit. Il va acheter des chaussures, vêtements, cosmétiques, etc. Bazile espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business les  Produit Divers.


Des autres membres  militant  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme  charbon, cosmetiques, chaussures, etc. Bazile dit que les  défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Bazile dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un  gros business avec son  fond et par la  grâce de Dieu.
texts.en: Bazile is the coordinator of his group called Les Refferances de Bordemer 4, 5 & 6.  He is a merchant and lives in the region of Bor de Mer where electricity is rare and water is very limited.  Bazile would like to use this loan to invest in various products. He will buy shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc.  Bazile hopes that this loan will help him to grow his business selling a variety of products. The other members of the group need loans for businesses such as coal, cosmetics, shoes, etc. Bazile says that the main challenge is to become a large merchant.  Bazile says that his main goal and his dream is to own a large business with his money and by the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is 43 years old and married with eight children. Romelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (a general store) in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 17000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

Romelita has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Romelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 43 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gema runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future Gema would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 38 years old, married to Nancy, and blessed with three children. He sells animals as well as animal feed. He has been in this business for the past year in the Narok area and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Solomon has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. He intends to buy more animal feed and some goats to sell.

He intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. His future plan is to become a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and some goats for resale.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene lives in the Kaspi district of East Georgia. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and an infant granddaughter. Her son and husband serve local people as taxi drivers and get monthly income. Elene runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a calf and two milk cows. She milks the cows every day and produces dairy products, which are sold in the nearby district. Elene is a very hard-working person, with a rich experience in her work.

Elene requested a loan to purchase a truck. Her husband will use the truck to take wood from the forest and sell it in their local village, as well in nearby villages. This will increase the family income during the winter season. The increased profit will be reinvested in the family agricultural activities, and all members of the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to haul wood to sell

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif, 48, is a farmer who breeds cattle for milk and meat purposes. He is married and has two sons. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in an IDP settlement. He has 10 years of experience in the cattle business.
 
The village where Arif lives is located in the southern part of Azerbaijan with very rigorous climate conditions. Summer temperatures reach 105 degrees  fahrenheit. The main problem in the region is adequate water for irrigation and for animals. Arif cannot afford to build a water channel for his animals. This expensive process requires a labor force and special equipment.  When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment to rent, like a tractor for making the water channel, and for workers who will dig the land.

He is trustworthy client of AqroInvest and has a good client history.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and hire laborers to dig a water channel.

loans.name: Mondoukpe Group

texts.fr: MONDOUKPE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Simone Céline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés. Simone Céline vit seule. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Simone Céline a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a près d’une vingtaine d’année que Simone Céline mène comme activité la vente des chaussures dans un marché du Bénin. Simone Céline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Simone Céline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Simone Céline sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MONDOUKPE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MONDOUKPE is a group of four people whose members live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Simone Celine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is married to a Julien. The couple have four children, some of whom attend school.  Simone Celine lives alone. The couple take care of the different household expenses together.  Simone Celine stopped attending school at the secondary level.  Almost 20 years ago, Simone Celine started a business selling shoes in a market in Benin.  Simone Celine is passionate about her business which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children.  Simone Celine stocks up at the market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Simone Celine is asking for a second loan with the other members of the Mondoukpe Group.  This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to earn more profits. Their prior loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Refuge De Dumas 1 & 2 Group

texts.fr:
Cantave est le coordinateur de son groupe Refuge de Dumas. Il est marié mais il a 5 enfants. Cantave habite dans la ville de Dumas d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Cantave a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années. 

Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait a l’ecole. Cantave voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des boeufs. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de les refuge ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. Cantave dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une camion pour transporter les animaux.
texts.en: Cantave is the coordinator of his group, Refuge de Dumas. He is married and has five children.  Cantave lives in the city of Dumas in Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited.  Cantave has managed his business for the past six years.  Before starting his business, he was in school. Cantave would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of cattle. He hopes this loan will help him expand his business. The other members of Refuge de Dumas need loans for businesses such as the sale of coal, rice, and fish.  Cantave says that his main challenge is the lack of steady buyers.  He says that his main goal is the growth of his business. His dream is the purchase of a truck to transport the animals.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: La Prosperite De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Clerdora est la coordonatrice de son groupe La Prosperite de Ouanaminthe.Elle  est un commercant. Ils habite dans la région  Ouanaminthe  où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée  

Clerdora a dirigé son  commerce de chaussures de tennis   pendant 5 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, elle était un etudiant. Clerdora voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans  les produit divers.

Des autres membres  militant  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme  les magasins d'aliments variés, des restaurants, de la nourriture et d'autres produits.

Clerdora espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce. Elle dit que les  défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante, et se conformera à l'aide de Dieu
texts.en: Clerdora is the coordinator of her group La Prosperity de Ouanaminthe.  She is a merchant.  They live in the region of Ouanaminthe where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Clerdora has run a tennis shoe business for five years. Before starting her business, she was a student.  Clerdora would like to use this loan to invest in various products. The other members of the group need loans for businesses such as grocery stores, restaurants, and stores selling food and other products.  Clerdora hopes that this loan will help her expand her business. She says that the main challenge is to become a large merchant, and she will comply with God's help.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise like shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Borrower Batjargal is 55 years old and lives with his family in an outer 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) district. He works as a specialist at a local company while his elder son works as a technician. His younger son attends university and he needs his tuition fees.  Batjargal's daughter operates a retail business. 

So he is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to pay his son's tuition fees and do construction work at his current house.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition fees and to do some construction work.

loans.name: Olfat

texts.en:
Olfat is a 28-year-old woman, who is married and a mother to three sons and two daughters. Her husband Yasser is a construction worker who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover their costs.

Olfat has almost finished building her house and now she wants to finish it, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting the house and installing windows and doors. Taking this loan will offer Olfat and her family suitable home conditions, so they will move to live in it soon, before the winter season is coming. Olfat appears in the photo with her husband Yasser and her younger son.

loans.use: To finish the house: painting and installing windows and doors

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

NWTF is presenting Nelia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Grace Martin

texts.en:
Grace is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Grace runs a restaurant, and has been in business for five years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase meat, rice, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years Grace   would like to expand her   business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Grace says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like meat, rice, 'dodo', etc.

loans.name: Adjokoue Group

texts.fr: ADJOKOUE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Jeanne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Jeanne n’a jamais été à l’école. Jeanne vit seule avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a quelques années que Jeanne exerce comme activité, la vente du pain et des sachets à son domicile. Jeanne exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Jeanne sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ADJOKOUE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: ADJOKOUE is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Jeanne (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 35-years old and married. The couple have two children, one of which is in school and all of which are dependents. Jeanne never attended school. She lives alone with her children.  The couple take care of the various household expenses together.  A few years ago, Jeanne started her business selling bread and packets from home.  Jeanne is passionate about her work which enables her to take care of her needs and those of her children.  In pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her working capital, Jeanne is asking for a third loan with the other members of Adjokoue. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to make more profit. Their prior loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Adjeniya Nouveau Group

texts.fr: ADJENIYA NOUVEAU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des parentés. La représentante du groupe, Awaou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est marié à un certain Fataï. Awaou est mère de quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Awaou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Awaou a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Awaou mène comme activité la vente de bicarbonates de façon ambulante. Awaou mène cette activité afin de pourvoir aux besoins du ménage. Awaou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Awaou sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA NOUVEAU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
ADJENIYA NOUVEAU is a group of three people who are related to each other. The group’s representative is Awaou, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Awaou, age 39, is married to a man named Fataï and they have four dependent children, some of whom go to school. Awaou lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Awaou received little schooling. She started selling bicarbonates door to door almost ten years ago. This helps her to meet some of the household needs. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, Awaou is seeking a loan together with the other members of the group ADJENIYA NOUVEAU. This credit will help them to meet customer demand and to bolster their profits.

loans.use: to buy bicarbonates for sale door to door.

loans.name: Nodicia

texts.es: Nodicia es una mujer trabajadora, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace muchos años ella y su familia dependen de la agricultura principalmente del cultivo del maíz y las hortalizas.  Lamentablemente los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para ayudar a cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Es por esta razón que como toda mujer emprendedora y visionaria   ha decidido acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar  este crédito que le permita invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios para el mantenimiento de la próxima cosecha y comprar insumos necesarios como insecticidas, pesticidas abonos u otros.  Es una mujer muy comprometida  en sus responsabilidades y siempre trabaja muy duro para cumplir las metas que se propone, por lo que en esta ocasión no será la excepción. Confía en Dios que tendrá resultados  favorables de esta inversión y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Nodicia is a hard working woman who lives in a house on her property together with her husband and children. For many years, she and her family have depended on agriculture, principally the cultivation of corn and vegetables. Sadly, the money that they make is not enough to help cover household expenses. This is why, as a hardworking and visionary woman, she decided to approach INTEGRAL to apply for a loan that would allow her to invest in the necessary supplies for the next harvest, and supplies such as insecticides, pesticides, fertilizers, or others. She is very committed to her responsibilities and she always works very hard to reach the goals that she sets for herself. This time will not be an exception. She trusts in God that she will get good results from this investment and be able to improve her quality of life and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies like pesticides, insecticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling scrap and junk in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to resell.

NWTF is presenting Rosita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 54 years old, married and has two children. She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden.

Vicenta has been farming vegetables for 5 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 58 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like biscuits, bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

Thelma has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Thelma aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items like biscuits, bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Mwamashango

texts.en:
Mwamashango is a veterinary officer, 37 years old, married, and lives with his four children who are all attending school. With his wife, they work to support their home; they have their own house. He sells veterinary medicine, a business he has been running for the last 12 years.

He is requesting a loan to invest in buying more stock of veterinary medicine for sale. The loan will be a significant contribution, providing money to expand his business. Mwamashango hopes to continue in business and offer a dignified life to his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of veterinary medicine for sale.

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alecia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 28 years.

In the future, Alecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora, 40, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Aurelio and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Leonora operates a small retail business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are hair clips, pony tails holders, toothbrushes, combs and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of supplies and products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leonora hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Al-Nrjs Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Nrjs and consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.  

Mokhls is the leader of the group, she is a 29-year-old married housewife. She requested a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies to make a kitchen for her house. She hopes to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to make a kitchen for her house.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is a farmer from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol. She is 58 years old, married and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Primitiva works hard to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

As of now, Primitiva is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the rent and maintenance of the equipment used on the farm. In the future, Primitiva dreams of expanding her business and making it sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the rent and maintenance of the equipment used on the farm

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 49-year-old, married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has four children, ages 27, 23, 18 and 12 years old, respectively. Lorena has been in the buy and sell business for 30 years. She buys and sells firewood, copra (the dried meat of the coconut), recycled cans, empty bottles and iron scrap. 

Lorena requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more firewood and copra and additional capital to buy empty bottles, recycled cans and iron scrap. In the future, Lorena would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, copra, empty bottles, iron and iron scrap

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto is a 37 year-old married man and a father of two young children, from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has been engaged in the tricycle transport business for several years now. This is the source of his income.  Restituto works hard to provide a good life to his family, especially for his children.

As of now, Restituto is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the tricycle. Restituto is optimistic that through this loan, he will be able to improve his income and business.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the tricycle

loans.name: Dulamjav

texts.en:
A resident of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital, 43-year-old Dulamjav lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, with her husband and two daughters, who are 18 and 19 years old. Both of her daughters attend public school and university. Dulamjav’s husband works as an accountant with a local company.

Dulamjav supports her family by operating three retail stalls at the Narantuul, Mongolia's largest outdoor market, where she sells tools and implements. When she first began her business in 2000, she had 700,000 MNT in working capital and one stall, but she has since expanded and now has 5,000,000 MNT in working capital at her three stalls. 

Dulamjav is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy more tools and implements to sell to her customers during the busy shopping season ahead. Her main goal for 2012 is to improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and implements to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 34 years old. She lives in the small village of Kaspi with her family: her husband, two children (13 and 15 years old) and a mother who is provided with retirement pension. Madona’s husband works as an artisan to get a monthly income. The children go to the local school. The family runs a dairy business – she has a calf and a milk cow. She milks a cow and produces cheese to sell in the nearby village. She is a very hardworking young woman and has rich experience in her work.


Madona requested a loan to cultivate agricultural land. After the land is cultivated, she will sow barley and do all relevant seasonal works to insure a good harvest. The harvested product will be sold at a good price and this will increase the family income. The increased income will be reinvested in family agricultural activities. Madona awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land for sowing barley

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter for cutting fodder

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a very industrious woman who is still selling cashew nuts  at the market. It is a business that most people may ignore but she narrates that it has given her very good results. Thanks to her efforts and the support from Kiva and Yehu, she has been able to cater for her children's education.

Mwanaisha is taking out a new loan so as to invest it in her existing business. She intends to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for sale. This way she hopes to provide better living to her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a 43-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in this business for more than 20 years now.

Sergio works hard to support his family especially for the schooling of his children. He is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net and fuel for the boat. 

Sergio hopes to make his business a success someday and continually support his children in their education.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 37 years old and lives with her life partner and their child in their own home. She makes a living selling dumplings. She has been operating her business for several years now and has gained much experience over the years. 

Mwanakombo is a hardworking woman who is always looking for new opportunities and who knows that if she puts forth her absolute best effort, she will achieve her goals. She has decided to invest in her business in hopes of strengthening it, but she lacks the financial capital to do so. She is requesting this loan from Yehu, which she hopes to put toward the purchase of wheat flour, cooking oil, food flavors, etc. 

Mwanakombo hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen her business and improve her quality of life and her family’s quality of life. She has a good history of making on time repayments, and she promises to keep up that trend with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, food flavors, etc.

loans.name: Mahuklo Renove Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO RENOVE est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Emilienne dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans. Emilienne est mariée à un certain Janvier. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Emilienne a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de huit ans que Emilienne mène comme activité la vente des trousseaux, boules d’akassa (aliment local fait à base de l’amidon du manioc) accompagné de poissons frits de façon ambulante. Emilienne exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Emilienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Emilienne sollicite un sixième crédit avec le second membre du groupe MAHUKLO RENOVE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mahuklo Renove is a group of two people who live in the same quarter.  The representative of the group, Emilienne (with her hand raised in the photo), is 30 years old.  She is married to a man named Janvier.  The couple has three children together, all of whom are in school and dependents.  The couple lives together with their children, and together provide for the various needs of the household.

Emilienne has only some education. As an itinerant saleswoman, it has been almost eight years since Emilienne began selling food packs -- bunches of akassa [a local dish prepared from cassava starch] accompanied by fried fish.  Emilienne carries out her business with a passion, which has allowed her to meet her needs. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

Striving for customer satisfaction, Emilienne is asking for a sixth loan along with the other member of the Mahuklo Renove Group. This loan will enable them to better respond to the demands of their clientele and earn more profits.  The previously issued loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase food packs.

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es: Marina habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su familia. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol. Después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y admirable ya que a pesar de su edad sigue trabajando y no se cansa de realizar esta actividad porque para ella, lo más importante en la vida es ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente con el trabajo de sus manos y el sudor de su frente para brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos. Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado sobrevivir, puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos diferente a la agricultura. Como toda mujer emprendedora y visionaria ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a INTEGRAL para  solicitar un préstamo e invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas como : semillas, insecticidas, abonos, u otros para comenzar la siembra lo antes posible y poder cosechar los frutos de su esfuerzo. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Marina lives with her family in the house she owns. She works growing two basic grains, which are corn and beans. After harvest she sells part of her crops so that she can cover her household's needs, which are greater every day. She is very driven and hardworking. She is an admirable woman because in spite of her age she keeps working and doesn't get tired of doing her work because the most important thing in life to her is earning her daily bread with dignity, her own two hands, and the sweat of her brow so that she can provide the best for her children. 

She has been a farmer all her life and that is how she has managed to survive, since she has no other source of income besides farming. Enterprising and visionary woman that she is, she made the decision to approach Integral to request a loan and invest in the purchase of farm supplies like seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, and other items so that she can start the seeding process as soon as possible and harvest the fruits of her effort. She is fully confident that she will obtain a plentiful harvest that will allow her to improve her quality of life as well as her family's.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 54 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. Julio cultiva los principales granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad ya que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Vale la pena mencionar que vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, pero esta situación no lo desanima si no que le dá fuerzas para continuar luchando por una calidad de vida diferente. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos  diferente a la agricultura. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL e invertir en la compra de insumos básicos como abonos, fertilizantes y pesticidas. Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para el consumo. Cabe mencionar que es muy responsable con sus pagos y nunca a tenido mayores inconvenientes. Se caracteriza por ser muy puntual y responsable en lo que tenga que pagar. Espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio, 54, lives in his own home together with his life companion and children. He has worked in agriculture for many years. He cultivates basic grains like rice, beans, and corn. Every year, he repeats this activity, since it is the only way he knows to make a living. He is a very hardworking, responsible, and enterprising person. He lives in very humble conditions with his family, but this does not get their spirits down, but rather gives them the strength to keep fighting for a different quality of life. He works very hard to bring the daily bread home because there is no source of income apart from agriculture. This is why he decided to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL and invest it in the purchase of basic supplies like manure, fertilizer, and pesticides. With a lot of trust in God and in his work, he hopes to have an abundant harvest, part of which he can sell and part of which he can keep to consume. He is very responsible with his payments and has never had an big problems. He is very responsible and on time with his payments. He hopes to achieve his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies like manure, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lkhagvasuren is a 37-year-old, married man who lives with his family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He works as a driver at local milk company while his elder two sons attend local primary school and daughter attends kindergarten. 

Lkhagvasuren plans to finish his housing work, besides his regular work, before cold winter season. He said, “it was really hard to live non-warm house last winter, so I decided to make it better.” For this reason, Lkhagvasuren applies for a Kiva loan from kind borrowers throughout the world.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Langoya Yonason

texts.en:
Langoya is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 13; all of them go to school.

Langoya runs a fish-selling business and has been in business for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase fish and other items. There is no other source of income for Langoya. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

In 5 years, Langoya would like to expand her business. Langoya says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella, 46, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Arnold, a land surveyor, and mother to their children. Two are already working while the youngest is still in high school. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bella operates a gown rental. She makes different kinds of gowns and has them rented.  These gowns are used in special occasions and other formal gathering. She also sells accessories for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 320 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials needed in making gowns and accessories to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Bella hopes her business grows more in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials needed in making gowns and accessories to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Fedel

texts.en:
This is Fedel, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is a single father. Together with his children, he manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Fedel operates a bridal gown retailing business. What he basically does is buy bridal gowns from his suppliers and sell them per item with a profit. His products are bridal gowns and dresses. His regular customers are people in the local community.  He earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of bridal gowns and dresses to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Fedel hopes to grow his business and dreams of being able to give his family a good future through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more bridal gowns and dresses to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is a 47 year-old married woman and a mother of three children, from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a business of selling clothing and other household utensils.  Serena wants to improve her business but lacks the financial resources to do so.  She is now requesting a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as clothing and others items, and to pay for the schooling of her children.
In the future, Serena dreams of making her business successful and sustainable so that it will generate more income necessary for their needs, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing and household utensils, and to pay for the schooling of her children

loans.name: Claber

texts.en:
Claber is a 52-year-old, married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She is a mother of five children. The oldest child is 32, while the youngest is 12 years old. 

Claber raises hogs. She has been in the hog-raising business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets, feeds like hog grower and hog finisher mash, and pig supplement. In the future, Claber would like to expand her business to be successful as well as to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplement

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 57-year-old, married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a dressmaking business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income.

Brenda is asking for a loan to buy materials for sewing such as cloth, thread, needles, buttons, zippers and others. Brenda dreams of improving her business and augmenting her income.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing such as cloth, thread, needles, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjollca is 28 years old, married, and has two young children, 1 and 3 years old. They come from the Ashkali community. Vjollca is a housewife and her husband works as a forger/ blacksmith. Her goal is to be able to pay for her children’s education.

For a long time they could not save enough money to renovate their house. As with all Ashkali community members, they live in very poor conditions. Their house is very old, and from the rain and snow in the previous winters, the doors and windows have become very damaged. Vjollca is requesting a loan of 600 euros for the first time in order to buy new windows and doors. The loan will help improve the living conditions for her family and keep them warm and dry and from getting sick in the winter season. Vjollca thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new windows and doors

loans.name: Sebastian Enrique

texts.es: Sebastian de 18 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hermanos y su madre, desde pequeño se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, humilde y entregado a lo que mas le gusta que es la ganadería es decir a la crianza y venta de animales. Es un hombre muy emprendedor es muy conocido por sus vecinos ya que es muy alegre y siempre busca ayudar a quien lo necesita, Sebastian busca siempre la manera de ser ejemplo para muchos y sobre todo sus hermanos. Actualmente se dedica a la ganadería y tiene en su poder una vaca que es la que le da ingresos vendiendo su leche, Él tiene el deseo de comprar mas ganado pero no tiene el capital suficiente para llevar a cabo esta ilusión, es por eso que se acerco a INTEGRAL a pedir un crédito el cual le servirá para complementar la compra de otra vaca, espera con sus proyecciones de crecer brindar un gran futuro a su mamá.
texts.en:
Sebastian is eighteen years old and lives with his three siblings and his mother. Ever since he was a child, he has always been very hardworking, humble, and dedicated to what he most enjoys, which is stockbreeding, that is, raising and selling animals. He is a very driven man and he is well-know by his neighbors for being very cheerful and always willing to help anyone that needs it. Sebastian always looks for ways to be a good role model for many, and particularly his siblings. 

He currently works as a stockbreeder and has a cow that provides him with income by selling her milk. He would like to purchase more cattle but he doesn't have enough capital to realize this dream, which is why he approached Integral to request a loan that will allow him to buy another cow. He has prospects for growth and hopes to give his mother a great future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Exitoso Ancoa Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Exitoso Ancoa” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; amasandería, peluquería, músicos, venta de ropa, venta de carbón, pastelería, articulos electrónicos, minimarket, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Aquiles, presidente del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color roja con franjas blancas, su cabello lo usa corto.
El se dedica al rubro de la reparación electrónica, desde hace 32 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, adapto un espacio en su casa para instalar un taller y atender a toda su clientela, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, sus  servicios son de mantención y reparación de equipos de amplificación y sonido profesionales, instrumentos e insumos musicales electrónicos. Además comenta que tiene un grupo de música donde complementa los ingresos para su hogar.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Linares en locales establecidos con articulos de electrónica, algunas veces se dirige a la ciudad de Santiago para comprar articulos que no encuentra en su ciudad a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará insumos electrónicos.
Una de las metas de Aquiles es continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Aquiles vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 29, 25, 21 y 16 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal es tener la posibilidad de vivir más hacia el sur, y a nivel familiar darle lo mejor a sus hijos(a) para que tengan un buen futuro profesional.
El está muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza , ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómodo con el grupo del cual forma parte ya que son unidos, y tienen una muy buena comunicación. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
 Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Exitoso Ancoa". It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, some of which are baking, hairdressing, music, clothing sales, coal sales, confections, electronics, and a mini-market, among others. All are from the city of Linares.

Aquiles, president of the communal bank, who in the photo is standing in the front row, third from the left, is wearing a red jacket with white stripes. He wears his hair short. He has worked in electronics repairs for 32 years. He works from home. He adapted a space in his home to install a workshop and  attend to customers. His work schedule in in accordance with his availability. He provided maintenance and repair services for professional amplification and sound equipment, and electronic musical instruments and supplies. He also has a music group that adds to his household income.

He buys the merchandise and supplies that he needs in the city of Linares in local shops that sell electronics. Sometimes he goes to the city of Santiago to buy the things he can't find at a low cost in his city, so it's economically convenient. He will buy electronic supplies with the loan.

One of his goals is to continue with the business, to generate more income, and that way achieve a greater quality of life. Alquiles lives with his four children, ages 29, 25, 21, and 16, who are all studying. His personal dream is to be able to live farther south, and his dream for his family is to give his children the best so that they have a good professional future.

He is very happy with and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given him, because it has allowed him to invest in his business. He is also very comfortable with the group that he is part of because they are very united, and they communicate very well. With regard to the training provided, he has learned how to better manage his business.

 Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the middle of the country. Agricultural production is very important in this area, along with wine production, and they stand out in the export sphere. Grains (rice, wheat, corn, and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard, and legumes) and fruits are important. Linares is the main producer of rice in Chile. In fact, 78% of national production of this grain occurs in this province, especially in the community of Parral.

loans.use: to buy electronic supplies.

loans.name: Buyantogtoh

texts.en:
Mr. Buyantogtoh is 52 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a ger, in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business of clothes retail. His oldest son is a university student and his younger sons are secondary school students. 

Mr. Buyantogtoh started a retail clothes trade business on a rental counter in 2012. He had been working as driver for 12 years before and has also been a herdsman. He is a hardworking person who says that "Our plan is to expand our business to cover all the tuition fees for our sons and let them educated and start their lives." He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to invest in his sons' education.

loans.use: To invest in his sons' education

loans.name: Ndugu

texts.en:
Ndugu, 36, is married and has six children. She lives in an urban area in the municipality of Mombasa, Kenya. She has been selling cashew nuts at the market for the past 8 years. She stocks for wholesale sales.

At present she’s requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy five sacks of cashew nuts and cater for their transport. She believes that the loan will help her better stock her store and increase sales. Her future goals consist of expanding her business and having other market outlets.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of cashew nuts and cater for their transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food products and merchandise to increase her turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, pasta, sugar, milk, soft drinks, and other merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair care products like shampoo, conditioner, dyes, straighteners, and a new hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Basti

texts.en:
Basti is a very kind and diligent woman. She is 52 years old and single. She has thirty years of experience managing a small grocery in Agsu region. This is the third time that Basti is receiving a loan from Agroinvest CU.

In conclusion, her aim is to expand her local business with a new loan of 1600 AZN (Azerbaijani Manats).  With the loan she will buy various products for inventory. Her net profit will be 120 AZN. Basti hopes that she will not only get profit, but also help to improve the welfare of the community, because she plans to sell products at low prices.

loans.use: to buy various products for inventory.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 38, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a porter, and is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Gina operates a business selling products like pillow cases, bedding and other linens. Customers are attracted due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gina hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to give her children an good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Sola

texts.en:
Sola is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sola breeds cattle and cows and has done so for the last 15 years. She decided to engage to this business because her husband had been cattle-breeding from youth and her pension was approaching.  

Sola usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sola also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for 1600 AZN loan in order to purchase three head of cattle, one milk cow and fodder.  This will be her third loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy three cattle, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
This is Charlene, 31, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jobert and is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Charlene operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sells them with a little profit. Her products are pillow cases, bedding and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Charlene is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Charlene hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuvshinjargal is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her 4 daughters in a ger in Govi-Altai province in Mongolia. Her oldest daughter works as a human resource manager at a medical center. Her second daughter is a university student and her younger 2 daughters are secondary school students. 

Mrs. Tuvshinjargal started her business of tailoring Mongolian national clothes and other clothes by order more than 10 years ago. She stopped her business because of lack of working capital. She got a job at a shopping center as a salesperson with a monthly salary of 180,000 MNT. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to restart her business of tailoring traditional and other clothes by order.

loans.use: To restart her business of tailoring traditional and other clothes by order

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is a 38-year-old woman, married with two sons. She breeds sheep and cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Sevil has 7 years of experience in this field, thanks to her husband who taught her best how to look after cattle and currently helps her to run the business. Her husband is a laborer and works in building projects. 

Sevil usually buys small sheep, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings 90 AZN income per month. Mutton are a very popular product in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Sevil also sells sheep fur which is useful for clothes and blankets.   

Sevil applied for 2,100 AZN to purchase 30 sheep. This will be her second loan and she has good client history.

loans.use: to buy 30 sheep

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en: Cornelio is a 39-year-old fisherman from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years and this is his sole source of income. He is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, a flashlight and cement to use to renovate his house. In the future, Cornelio wants to improve his business and increase his income so that he can provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, a flashlight and cement to renovate his house.

loans.name: Miljana

texts.en: Miljana lives in Kosovo in a Roma community with her five children, who range in age from one to nine years old. Three of them currently attend school. Miljana is divorced and earns a living by producing handicrafts which she sells. Her work is very unique, which allows her to earn a lot of money. She also works from her home, which allows her to care for her children and keep expenses down. She needs a loan to buy materials for her work. The loan will improve her working conditions and allow her to generate more income. In the future she hopes to improve her family's life and provide the best education for her children. She is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy materials for a handicraft business.

loans.name: Manuel Armando

texts.es: Manuel tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz, frijoles y maicillo. El cultivar esos granos son su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha realizado esta actividad por mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida honradamente. Él es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y dedicado en su trabajo. Es muy conocido por sus vecinos los cuales dan buenas referencias de su trabajo como de su persona. Cada año repite está actividad ya que es una persona muy humilde y de escasos recursos el cual no puede accesar a otro tipo de negocio o trabajo por carecer de mayor preparación académica. Este año al igual que los anteriores ha decidido cultivar la tierra y ya que aún es tiempo para sembrar, quiere estar preparado con los  insumos agrícolas necesarios  para cosechar los principales granos básicos. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita crédito a  INTEGRAL, ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios  para realizar la inversión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas,  u otros. De esta forma espera lograr cultivar los principales granos básicos de este año y así continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, 39, lives in his own house with his family.  He makes a living growing basic grains: corn, beans, and millet.  This is his main source of income.  He has done this work for a long time and it's how he earns an honest living.  He's a very responsible and honest man who is dedicated in his job.  He's very well known among his neighbors, who give him good references for both his work and his character.

He does this job every year because he's a very humble person of few resources who doesn't have the means to do any other type of business or work because he lacks an education.  This year, as in the past, he decided to grow a crop, and because it's already time to plant, he wants to be ready with the necessary supplies to grow the main basic grains.  This is why he's requesting a loan from Integral, because he doesn't have the financial resources necessary to make the investment.

He's going to invest the loan in agricultural inputs, including seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.  This way he hopes to grow the main basic grains of the year and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 15,900 pesos Deyanira ha podido comprar provisiones tales como ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 1 lata de aceite, leche, huevos y bebidas refrescantes para su tiendita de comida. Deyanira perdió su empleo hace 18 meses, y con el dinero que le dieron de seguro de desempleo abrió esta tienda, con la que ayuda a su esposo a sostener el hogar. Él trabaja como vendedor en una tienda de libros. Tienen 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años, quienes estudian en la escuela pública del barrio.
Deyanira ha entendido que si desea mantener una clientela fija, debe mantener su negocio siempre bien surtido de provisiones frescas, por esto ha solicitado este préstamo.

Tanto ella como su esposo desean que el negocio marche bien y genere ingresos suficientes para poder apoyar a sus hijos a estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
A loan of 15,900 pesos allows Deyanira to purchase provisions such as half a sack of rice, half a sack of sugar, a tin of oil, milk, eggs, and soft drinks for her little grocery store. Deyanira lost her job eighteen months ago, and she used her unemployment benefits to open this store, which enables her to help her husband support their household. He works at a book store. They have three children, who are seventeen, fourteen, and eleven, and all three attend the neighborhood public school.

Deyanira has come to understand that if she wants to maintain a steady customer base, she needs to always keep her business well-stocked with fresh groceries. That is why she has requested this loan. Both her and her husband want the business to do well and generate enough income for them to help their children go to college.

loans.use: to purchase provisions such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, eggs, and soft drinks for her little grocery store.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Esperanza, tiene 13  miembros, donde todas trabajan con la esperanza de salir adelante y de ayudar a sus familias, son mujeres jefas de familia que ayudan a los suyos por medio de su trabajo.
Olga se dedica a la venta de joyas de todo tipo, y cuenta que está saliendo adelante gracias a su sacrificio y esfuerzo, y por medio de sus ventas ayuda a su familia. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y así convertirse en una gran microempresaria.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas de todo tipo, como ser anillos, cadenas, pulseras y demás, para poder seguir trabajando y progresando.
texts.en:
The ‘Esperanza’ [Hope] communal bank has 13 members.  All of them work with the hope of getting ahead and helping their families.  They are all women who are the head of their household, and they help their loved ones through their work.

Olga sells all types of jewelry.  She says that she is getting ahead thanks to her sacrifice and effort.  Through her sales, she helps her family.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing and to become a great small businesswoman.

She is requesting the loan to buy all types of jewelry like rings, necklaces, bracelets, and the rest.  She will do this to be able to continue working and progressing.

loans.use: to buy rings, necklaces, and bracelets, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a tractor

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti sells seafood for a living. She is accompanied by her husband, and has three children. She started this business because her family needed an extra income. 
She currently needs to invest in her business, purchasing fresh seafood to meet customer demand. She will purchase fish and cooking oil, which will help her business be financially solvent and meet customer demand.
She expects good returns from this loan, an investment that will allow her to increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life in the future

loans.use: purchase fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 50 year-old married woman who has a grown daughter. She lives in San Jose, Talibon, Bohol.  Zenaida has been engaged in the hog raising business for some time now. She also runs a sari-sari store, or convenience store, selling various goods.
Zenaida is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs, and additional items to sell such as noodles, soda, bread, soap, shampoo and others.

In the future, Zenaida dreams of making her business a success and making it more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs and additional items to sell such as noodles, soda, bread, soap, shampoo others

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is a 44-year-old woman, married with two daughters. She is a farmer raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has more than 8 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person. Her husband is an auto mechanical engineer and works in a car repair center.

Bahar usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Bahar's monthly income is 80 AZN. Working in the open air and raising crops is taking a lot of strength, which is very hard for a woman and that why her son and husband help Bahar. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase monthly turnover. For this purpose Bahar applied for 1,400 AZN. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 26 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. Her immediate family consists of her husband and a daughter, who is still young. They reside in the suburban area of Mombasa.

Mariam intends to start a general store to sell basic home products. She anticipates achieving good results. At the moment, Mariam is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES, so that she can buy foods, medicines, soft drinks, detergents and other household items, to stock her store. She believes that the financial support she is receiving will help her to grow and move forward. This loan should help her to improve her living standard and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy foods, medicines, soft drinks, detergents and other household items, to stock her store.

loans.name: Aquilia

texts.en: Aquilia  is a 40-year-old married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has four children who range in age from five to 18 years old.  She earns a living by raising pigs, and has been in this line of work for four years. She earns money on the side by selling coffee. Her husband earns a living as a driver for a private company. Aquilia is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 buy additional piglets, feed for them to eat and coffee. She would like to expand her business in order to better support her family and send her children to school so they have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed, and coffee.

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 43 years old, married and has three children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Sevinc has more than eight years of experience in this field thanks to his father, who taught her how to best look after cattle. Her husband works as builder and receives an 80 AZN salary, which is too low to support the family.

Sevinc usually buys calves, raises and fattens them over five to six months, and resells them for a profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. She sells milk and yogurt to neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings in 210 AZN per month. Milk and yogurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yogurt sauce. Dairy products are considered to be very healthy and are present in everyday life. 
  
The family's income is not enough to cover basic needs of her beloved children. Sevinc applied for 1600 AZN to purchase three cattle and one milk cow. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Rehema
