texts.en: Rehema has earned a living by operating a food stall for the last year. She is married and has two children. She opens her shop every day and has a good clientele base. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to use to prepare her fast foods. Rehema plans to buy wheat flour, five liters of corn oil, rice, sugar, and other items. These ingredients will increase her sales possibilities. She hopes to expand her business in the future, improve the financial situation of her family and, with this loan, have the opportunity for a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, corn oil, rice, sugar, and other items for a food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, eggs, beans, noodles, and soft drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Chimedtsermaa

texts.en: Chimedtsermaa is 68 years old and had lived with her daughter in a little house in the Songinokhairkhan district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her daughter graduated university and went to Korea for work. Chimedtsermaa had worked for a tailoring company since 1990. She retired from the company and now is starting her own tailoring business at home. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new sewing machine and inventory. She is a very hardworking person who says "I want to have own workplace in the future."

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and inventory.

loans.name: Biapaye .j

texts.en: Biapaye is 47 years old and lives in West Point. He’s married and has four children between the ages of 11 to 20. They live at home with their parents and are in school, For four years, Biapaye has been operating a grocery store where she sells toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, body cream and many items. He has many customers since his business is in a very good location. He is requesting a loan to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, body cream and many items for his business. He plans to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, body cream and many items for his business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. She has one child and has earned a living for the last 20 years by producing milk and various crops. She enjoys farming, but suffers from a lack of capital. She will use this loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She likes being a client at Juhudi Kilimo because it offers low interest rates and good repayment terms. Her main monthly expense is caring for her family. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?," Esther replied "I will get more income from my dairy cows and therefore be able to better provide for my family's needs." 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. She has a household mosquito net and electricity, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV or a DVD player

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send it to a central online repository. This reduces our paper use, makes the lending business more efficient, and keeps costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is a 56-year-old businesswoman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for several years. She cooks food and sells it to the people in her community.

Normalita dreams of expanding her business, but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business, such as meat, vegetables and seasonings. Normalita dreams of making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business, such as meat, vegetables and seasonings

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is 26 years old, married and has three children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. Deep knowledge of her business and eight years of experience help her to run the business successfully. 

Zeynab usually sells the crop from her garden in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes use vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family and also are used to make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air is very hard for a woman which is why her husband helps Zeynab. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seed and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she raises and increase monthly turnover. For this purpose she applied for a loan of 1900 AZN. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 51,750 pesos Mariana ha podido instalar la tramería (estantes) que le faltaban a su tienda, así como comprar un congelador y un inversor de energía eléctrica, pues el problema de falta de energía eléctrica es un problema grave en la república Dominicana.
Mariana inició en este negocio hace 16 meses y el mismo ha ido creciendo de manera sostenida, de manera tal que los estantes que actualmente tiene no son suficientes para la cantidad de mercancía que hay en el negocio.
Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de agrimensor y juntos tienen 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 13 años. El año próximo el mayor va a la universidad, por lo que tanto Mariana como su esposo han estado ahorrando lo más posible para apoyarlo.
El mayor sueño de Mariana es que sus hijos estudien y vayan a la universidad, pues “Solo estudiando los pobres podemos salir de la pobreza”
texts.en:
A loan of 51,750 pesos allows Mariana to install the shelving her store needs and purchase a freezer and an electrical power inverter, because lack of electrical power is a serious problem in the Dominican Republic.

Mariana started her business sixteen months ago and it has been growing steadily, so the current shelving she has is not enough for the amount of merchandise there is in her business.

Her husband works as a land surveyor's assistant and together they have three children, who are eighteen, fifteen, and thirteen. The oldest will start college next year, so both Mariana and her husband have been saving as much as they can to support him.

Mariana's greatest dream is for her children to study and go to college, because "for us who are poor, the only way out of poverty is education."

loans.use: to install more shelving in her store and purchase a freezer and an electrical power inverter.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 37 years old and lives in West Point. He is married, and his wife is a businesswoman. They have four children between the ages of five and sixteen years. All four children live at home with their parents.

For six years now, Augustine has been operating a grocery store where he sells toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice and many items. He has many customers, since his business is in a very good location.

Augustine is requesting a loan to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice and many other items for his business. He plans to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice and many items for his business.

loans.name: La Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y crecer en cada uno de los emprendimientos.
Ignasia es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, cuenta que para empezar fue un poco difícil, pero que después fue abriéndose camino y hoy en día ya es muy conocida y tiene muy buena clientela. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esta forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás para poder seguir haciendo sus pedidos.
texts.en:
15 hard-working and entrepreneurial women joined together with the desire to get ahead and grow each of their ventures. 

Ignacia is a member of this group, she works as a seamstress. She says that it was difficult to begin, but then she made her way and today she is well known and has very good customers. Her goal is to continue growing and thus continue helping her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc. to continue meeting her orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and more.

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa is a 49-year-old woman who grows seasonal fruits and vegetables. She is single. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar's IDP Settlement. Shukufa bred cattle for 5 years. She receives 40 AZN monthly in financial support from the government, but this is too low to cover her family's needs.

Shukufa sells her crops in the central bazaar. Her son helps her grow and sell her crops in the bazaar. Her monthly income is 60 AZN, and this business is her family's main source of financial income. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them to be healthy, and many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruit is served at every Azerbaijani family's table and is also used to make fresh punch.

Shukufa wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be her second loan, and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 34 years old and lives in Mtskheta district with his family – his parents, wife, and two children. His parents are pensioners. Vazha works as a watchman and gets a monthly salary. His family has a dairy business. They have two milk cows and produce yogurt. Vazha sells milk and yogurt locally. In addition, the family owns a greenhouse, where they grow flowers in season, which they sell. Besides all of that, Vazha transports people to the capital city with his own minibus, and gets monthly income doing so. He is a very hard-working young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

Vazha is requesting a loan to repair his minibus. It has been damaged, and therefore Vazha stopped working with it. After the minibus has been repaired, he will be able to resume transporting people and get more income. With the increased profit, he will improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to repair his minibus, so he can resume transporting people and get more income.

loans.name: Shaqir

texts.en:
Shaqir is twenty years old and married. He is a father of one child. He works in agriculture, cultivating potatoes with a very low salary. His wife stays at home and is a housewife.

Shaqir is requesting a loan for the first time in order to renovate his house and the façade. This loan will help him a lot, because without this help, he would not manage to renovate his house. In the future, he hopes to improve the living conditions of his family. His goal is to give his family a sustainable future.

He and his wife are very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to renovate his house and the façade.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is 40 years old and lives in West Point. He is married and has two children, ages 1 and 8. For the past five years he has been running a shop, where he sells many items like sneakers and shoes. He has a lot of customers, and his daily sales are very high during the dry season. Abraham is requesting a loan to purchase more items like sneakers and shoes for his business. He plans to expand his business and wishes a brighter future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sneakers and shoes for his shoe store.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Nyamsuren is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and her son in a Ger, in the Sainshand province of Mongolia. Her husband mines for spar and does other businesses for the family. Her son goes to secondary school. 

Mrs. Nyamsuren is planning to start a grocery store from her husband’s business profits. She is a hardworking and responsible person. Before she used to sell food products at a local market, but that was a seasonal business and the profit was not sustainable. Now she is requesting 600,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her grocery business. She says: “I'm planning to expand my business.”

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her grocery business

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago es una persona muy emprendedora y siempre su visión ha sido brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es un hombre trabajador, honesto y honrado que jamas le ha quedado mal a nadie. Vive con su familia y es un hombre de hogar, el encargado de llevar el pan de cada día. Sus oficios son agricultor y pescador y es así como día a día  sale de su casa con nuevos propósitos que es seguirle dando un mejor futuro a su familia. Actualmente se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito ya que no cuenta con las semillas y granos básicos para la cosecha de la que aún es tiempo sembrar, por ello necesita comprar semillas mejoradas de maíz y frijol para sembrar. Confía en Dios de que pronto su ayuda sea otorgada y poder así realizar una vez mas las cosechas que acostumbra con seguridad obtener y con ellas cubrir los pagos necesarios para pagar cuanto antes la deuda adquirida
texts.en:
Santiago is a very enterprising person who has always envisioned providing the best for his family.  He is a hardworking and honest man who has never let anyone down.  He lives with his family, and he is the man of the house in charge of providing for their daily needs.  Santiago is a farmer and fisherman, and he leaves his house each day with new ideas about how to continue to provide the best future for his family.  

At this time, he has seen the need to request a loan, because he does not have the seeds to plant while it is still time to sow.  Therefore, he needs to buy improved corn seeds and beans to plant.  He trusts in God that your help will be granted quickly, so that he will be assured of getting the kind of harvest that he usually gets and thus be able to pay off the debt as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds to plant

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.en:
Shovkat is 56 years old and a divorced woman. She has a son. Together, they have been playing a major role in the development of their trade for a long time. Shovket has fifteen years experience in selling mixed products in Agsu district. Her monthly net profit is 110 AZN. They provide for consumers' needs with great pleasure.
Of course, with the 1200 AZN loan, Shovkat intends to expand her store.
This is the second time that she is taking a loan from Agroinvest CU. She wants to buy many school supplies, toys, souvenirs and other items for her store, to earn profits, continue her selling profession and also provide for consumer demands.
She believes that this loan will have a positive impact on her trade.

loans.use: To buy new mixed products such as school supplies, toys, souvenirs and other items

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, aged 28, is married and has one child. She lives in the municipality of Mombasa. She has her own business selling African dishes. She established her business in her house one year ago. She sells her customers a variety of foods. Gladys is currently requesting her first loan cycle, which is for 20,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy supplies used in making the dishes. She will buy things like meat, vegetables, condiments, rice, beans, soft drinks, etc.

Her goal is to increase sales, to manage to have funds saved, and to give her daughter an education.

loans.use: buy things like meat, vegetables, condiments, rice, beans, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Darío

texts.es:
Darío es un señor de 54 años que se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a enseñar a leer y escribir a niños de todas las edades donde tiene una gran experiencia en la Educación primaria, profesión que eligió porque le apasiona y le da satisfacción, tanto así que hoy en la actualidad dirige un colegio de una comarca ubicada a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce.
Es una persona emprendedora, originario de un caserío de escasos recursos que día a día lucha para poder llegar y cumplir a su puesto de trabajo venciendo los obstáculos como en temporada de invierno que se crece el río de Los panales No 1 y se dañan los caminos de acceso.

Gracias a  su salario y el apoyo que le ha brindado KIVA a través de Ceprodel ha mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda, la ha ampliado donde hoy sus pequeños hijos y esposa gozan de mayor espacio lo que se siente muy satisfecho y agradecido.

Está solicitando un crédito para compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y perlines para terminar de construir un cuarto porque su objetivo es tener una vivienda digna a pesar de ser un humilde asalariado piensa en tener un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Darío is a 54 year-old man who has dedicated almost all of his life to teaching children of all ages to read and write.  He has a lot of experience teaching at the elementary school level, a profession that he chose because of his passion for teaching.  This work gives him a lot of satisfaction, so much that now he is the principal of a school in a district that is located 10 kilometers from the town of El Sauce.

Darío is an enterprising person who is a native of a poor rural settlement.  Over time, he struggled to be able to get his teaching job, overcoming obstacles such as seasonal winter flooding of the Los Panales No. 1 river, which damaged the roads he used for access.

Thanks to his salary, and the support provided by Kiva through CEPRODEL, he has improved the condition of his home.  He has expanded it, and now his small children and wife can enjoy having more space, which makes him feel very pleased and grateful.

He is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, corrugated metal roofing material and beams so that he can finish construction of a room, because  his goal is to have a decent home in spite of being a humble employee and he is thinking about having a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, corrugated metal roofing material and beams

loans.name: Women Life Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 women who are working in the sale of sandals, fish, provisions, soft drinks and metal coal pots. They all live in Teshie and meet up every Thursday to discuss business and payments towards the loan.

Mary is 60 years old, single, and sells fish and sandals. All her children are now independent and are working to take care of themselves. She has been doing this job for 26 years at her residence. She starts work at 6:00am and closes at 6:00pm. She needs 800 Ghana cedis to increase stock by buying 3 cartons of fish and 1 box of sandals. This is her 3rd loan cycle; in the 2nd loan she was given 500 Ghana cedis which was used for the same purpose. She has been using her profit for a housing project: that is why she is requesting 800, so that she can buy enough to sustain her business.

They need a total amount of 2350 Ghana cedis to be able to buy enough goods.

loans.use: To buy 3 cartons of fish and 1 box of sandals to supply to customers.

loans.name: Ferdenand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 35 years old and is married with one child, who is three years old. He is known for selling various goods such as: sugar, biscuits, lotions, soap etc. 

Ferdinand has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: sugar, biscuits, lotions, soap etc for resale. With this loan, Ferdinand will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, he will continue improving his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: sugar, biscuits, lotions, soap etc for resale.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 55 years old. She lives in Gardabani district of East Georgia. She has a large family: husband, son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren. Her husband has been provided with a retirement pension. The family has 2 milk cows and sheep. They have a dairy business and sell milk and yogurt in the local village. Mzia also sells lambs. She is very hard-working and takes good care of her family.

Mzia requested a loan for purchasing building materials and expanding the shed for sheep. The existing shed needs renovation and is already too small to keep the livestock. After expanding the shed they will be able to fulfill future plans and expand their animal husbandry business. She needs your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and expand the shed for sheep

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es: José Abel es un agricultor de  cuarenta y tres años de edad se dedica también a trabajos de albañilería y la venta de  granos básicos, vive juntos a su familia, es una persona muy dedicada responsable  quien goza de mucha experiencia que ha forjado desde los 15 años quien se inicio en las labores jornaleras y también posee buena credibilidad en cuanto a su producto por parte de sus compradores, el cliente no cuenta con ningún crédito pendiente actualmente y solicita a INTEGRAL que le facilite un crédito para la compra de insumos semilla de maíz y frijol, abono, herbicida, etc., el cliente busca esta inversión para lograr una mejor  calidad de vida y para el sustento de su familia, y asegura poder cubrir el monto del crédito dentro del plazo establecido.
texts.en: José Abel is a 43-year-old farmer. He also works as a bricklayer and sells basic grains. He lives with his family and is a very dedicated and responsible person. He has a lot of experience; he has been a farmer for fifteen years. He started off as a day labourer. His buyers have a great deal of confidence in his produce. He does not have any unpaid loans pending. He is requesting that INTEGRAL provide him with a loan for the purchase of corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, etc. He hopes to make this investment in order to achieve a better quality of life and sustain his family. He assures us that he will be able to repay the loan as established.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu, 37, lives with her husband and four children. She’s a very responsible woman, who works hard to provide her children with the best life possible. Saumu has a food stall located at the market. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Saumu is asking for a loan to buy charcoal and ingredients, such as flour, cooking oil, and flavorings. She is a very kind and cheerful lady, who is always striving to get ahead and provide everything necessary for her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and ingredients, such as flour and cooking oil, for her food stall.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives with her husband and their son. Through her hard work, she has a beauty salon business. Her hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. She learned her trade through an academy where she was trained in this line of work.

She is asking for a loan in in order to purchase products such as makeup, dyes, skin creams, hair creams, a dryer and a blow dryer. This loan will be a big help to Gladys in investing in her business and keeping it competitive.

Gladys wants to be able to increase the standard of living for her family and herself through the business, and to be able to have her own business premises, since she rents the premises where she currently operates her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as makeup, dyes, skin creams, hair creams, a dryer and a blow dryer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children, aged 13, 9 and 7 years. He operates a butcher shop, a business he began six years ago, and he earns a monthly income of 38,000 KES. 

He has requested a second loan of 80,000 KES to purchase pigs and sheep for slaughter in order to increase the stock of meat in his butchery. 

The profit he makes from his businesses will help him repay his loan. His dream for the future is to own a lorry and a big building in town.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and sheep for slaughtering

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old and lives in Airport. She went to school up to grade 7. She is married and has four children between 10 and 28 years of age who live with her and go to school. Her husband works with Firestone. 

Alice started her business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, clothes, and slippers for her business. She hopes to build a house for family and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, clothes, and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
La Señorita Mariana tiene 28 años ella es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Ella se había independizado de sus padres por sus estudios ya que vivía muy lejos y por la dificultad de los medios de transportes decidió alquilar un departamento.
Ella termino la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial y por mucho tiempo ha trabajado en distintas empresas, pero luego se quedó sin trabajo y entonces junto con su hermana decidieron comprar calzados y venderlos sobre pedidos  ya sea al contado y luego le anexaron prendas deportivas de marcas conocidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados y prendas de vestir, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la clientela que tiene.
texts.en:
Mariana is 28 years old, single and lives in the city of Villa Elisa. She become independent of her parents because of her studies since, she lived very far and because of the poor of the means of transport decided to rent a apartment. 

She finished the career of commercial engineering and, for a long time, she worked in different companies, but then she was without a job. Together with her sister decided to start buying and selling shoes on a cash or credit basis. Later they added sportswear brands. 

She requests this loan to purchase shoes and clothing, so she can continue working and fulfilling with her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothing

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 62 years old. She lives in Kakheti region of East Georgia. She is married and has a son and daughter-in-law. Liana is a pensioner. Her husband has his own car and works in transportation. Liana’s son works as an electrician locally, and gets a monthly income. Each member of the family works hard and tries to improve their living conditions.

Liana requested a loan to have a plot of land cultivated. After the land has been cultivated, the family will sow wheat and alfalfa. They will do all relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest. The family will sell the harvested crops at a good price, and this will increase the family's profit significantly. Liana awaits your support.

loans.use: to have a plot of land cultivated, and to sow wheat and alfalfa there.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 30-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines, and the mother of three children. She has run a sari-sari or convenience store for more than four years now.

Jennifer is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store, such as noodles, canned goods, candies, snack foods, soap, and shampoo. In the future, Jennifer wants to make her business successful and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She earns her living selling juice and ice cream from her home. In addition to this, she also owns a rental house that gives her a monthly income of about 15,000 KES.

Halima is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is always on the lookout for new ways to be successful. She is currently asking for this loan so as to renovate the rental house. She plans to buy cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do home repairs.

loans.name: Third Junction Group

texts.en:
Third Junction Group has a membership of four women who sell cloth, fish, second-hand clothing, towels and onions. 

Janet is 34 years old. She lives with her parents and two children. She sells second-hand clothing and towels.

She has been selling second-hand clothing for seven years. She moves from house to house to deliver her goods to her customers. 

Janet is on her third loan cycle with ID Ghana, Kiva's partner. She needs 850 Ghana cedis (GHS) to buy one bill of second-hand clothing. She was given 600 GHS in her second loan cycle and paid her loan without trouble.

She uses her profits to take care of her family and to reinvest.

Together, all four members need 2,100 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a bill of second-hand clothing and towels

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana es una mujer joven con 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre. No tiene hijos. Es simpática, trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Se dió cuenta de los servicios que brinda Fundación  Mujer por medio de otras clientas. Actualmente está cursando su bachillerato por madurez. Hace año y medio se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa fina y bisutería, sin descuidar su hogar y sus estudios. Le va muy bien por su forma de ser y el trato que le da a sus clientes. Su meta es crecer en el negocio para obtener los ingresos necesarios y terminar una carrera universitaria, asi mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Adriana is a 24 year old woman who is in a common law marriage. She doesn't have children. She is kind, hardworking and has entrepreneurial vision. She found out about the services offered by the Fundación  Mujer through other clients. Right now she is getting her high school degree as an adult. For a year and a half she has been a door to door saleswoman of fine clothes and jewelry without negelcting her home or her studies. It is going well for her because of her personality and the way she treats her customers. Her goal is to grow in her business and obtain the income she needs and finish college, thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fine merchandise, shirts, and blouses as well as jewelry.

loans.name: Igualdad Para Todas Group

texts.es:
Igualdad para todas es un grupo integrado por 13 mujeres del Chaco, ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
 Lizzie es parte del grupo, ella es vendedora de prendas, y cuenta que tiene buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y así gracias a su trabajo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, en especial de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder surtirse.
texts.en:
"Equality for All" is a group formed by 14 women from Chaco, they are in the first term and are learning to work together and help each other.
Lizzie is part of the group, she sells clothing and has a good client base because she always has a good variety to offer her clients and thanks to her work she is getting ahead.
She requests this loan to buy clothing of all kinds, particularly summer clothing because the heat is approaching and she wants to stock up for the season.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a very hard-working girl and has decided to start a new business sewing women’s dresses in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her family’s finances. She took a course on “How to get ahead” at a women’s organization and acquired some business skills. Aziza is confident she will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for her new business. She will get through, using her loan to grow her business so that it will become  a source of income and help her family to have both a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon runs a general shop in Tala, where he sells flour, sugar, cooking fat, and hair pieces, among other items. His customers come from Tala and its surroundings. He has been running this business for five years, and he makes a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office. 

Simon has applied for a loan of 100,000 KES, to increase his stocks of sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and wheat flour. Simon plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his shop to wholesale. 

Simon describes himself as hard-working, and he dreams of having a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 26-year-old single gentleman. He has a transportation business for people in different regions of the city. He has gotten a lot of customers because his work is reliable, and he has affordable prices. 

Samwel is a man who is very dedicated to his job, and he likes to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves. He thinks that he who perseveres in his goals will reach them and be compensated with great success. 

He wants to see his business grow, and this is why he asks for a loan from Yehu, which will allow him to buy the spare parts that he needs and do general servicing of his motorcycle. He is confident that in this way he'll be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do general servicing of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Tserenpil

texts.en: Ms. Tserenpil is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in their own little house in the Orkhon province of Mongolia. Her husband helps her with her business selling dairy products and her elder daughter goes to secondary school, while the younger stays at home. She started her business in 2005 with a working capital of 300,000 MNT. Now her working capital has risen to 1,995,000 MNT. Her business is sustainable, and she is planning to reserve enough dairy products for the winter to sell at retail prices. Ms. Tserenpil is a hard-working and welcoming woman who says, "I am happy with Xacbank's products; they have been supporting my business for a long time." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase enough dairy products for the winter.

loans.use: To purchase enough dairy products for winter

loans.name: Prestige Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old Yollander E from Harare. She is married with two children, one attending school. She also cares for two dependents. Yollander E runs a clothing business selling kidswear, handbags and cosmetics. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenge she faces is the high rental fees for shops in the central business district. 

Yollander E has requested a loan of 750 ZWL to purchase kids' clothing and comestics to sell during the festive (Christmas) season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future, Yollander E plans to own her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase kids' clothing and comestics to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is a 23-year-old single young man.  His family works in agriculture, mainly in cultivating olives.

Asaad is studying at a local Palestinian university, specializing in social studies. Asaad wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Asaad and improve his family's living conditions. Asaad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a very enterprising person who has always worked and is not afraid of challenges. His goal is to be able to continue growing and this way be able to continue helping his family, since he is now married and has a child.

Thanks for the previous loan that helped him to expand his former business and save money to start a new one. He has a retail shop, and he wants to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sodas, etc.

His aim is to own a vehicle for transport services.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as juice, lotions, soap, water, clothes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Gëzim

texts.en:
Gezim, who is 31 years old, is married and has two children ages six and eight years old. He currently works in a fast food shop with a very low salary. His wife stays at home and is a housewife, taking care of the children and home. 

Gezim’s house is in need of some renovations because it has been a long time since he was able to repair his house. 

Gezim is requesting a loan in order to buy new windows and doors. These renovations are necessary to be completed before the winter season, as they will help keep the house insulated and therefore warmer in the colder weather. As it is well known in Kosovo, the weather in the winter is cold and long. 

In the future Gezim hopes to open a small farm with cows and sheep. His goal is to be able to save the money for children's future. Gezim wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To by new windows and doors.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 50 years old and is married, with five children  between 7 and 18 years old. He owns a sewing business. He has five years of experience, and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Viateur has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more machines and other materials for his sewing to get more profit. With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, he will continue improving his family.

loans.use: To buy more machines and other materials for his sewing business.

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
Ayed is a 34-year-old young man. He is married and a father to three sons and three daughters. Ayed lives in a village distinguished for agriculture, particularly the cultivation of olives. He is employed and earns a low salary, which is his only source of income and is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Ayed has been building his house and now wants to start finishing it, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing windows and doors. This loan will offer to Ayed suitable home conditions and allow he and his family to enjoy living in their house soon. 

Ayed is photographed at the location of his house.

loans.use: to install windows and doors to complete his house.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 36 years old and lives in Airport. She is married and has children between 15 and 21 years old who are in school and live at home. She stopped her education at 11th grade and her husband worked with Firestone.

Comfort been selling used clothes for the past 7 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. A problem she is facing is less commodities. 

Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ezabel

texts.en:
Ezabel is 45 years old, married to Joseph, who contributes to the family income. They have three children between the ages of 12 and 20 years old.

Ezabel has been a commercial farmer for about two years. Her income is 35,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is her second loan from the Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology. She wants to use it to buy poultry feeds. She hopes be a leading poultry farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Nawal prefers that her photo not be on the Internet.  Thus the photo is of her son Rami. 

Nawal is a 42-year-old woman.  She is married and mother to two sons and four daughters.  Her husband is a worker across the border, and her elder son is preparing to open a store of Internet games.

Nawal's son wants to ensure a stable source of income, so he will improve the family's income positively.

Nawal wants to help her son, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN  to cover the cost of purchasing number of computers. Taking this loan will enable Nawal to participate with her son in preparing well for the opening of his project successfully, which will lead to improving the family's income for the better.

loans.use: To buy computers for her son's Internet games store

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.es: Areopaquita de  63 anos de edad, soltera sin hijos, es originaria del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Areopaquita tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos desde hace 34 anos. El negocio consiste en vender cosméticos al contado y al crédito como lápiz labial, lápiz de ojos, delineador, rubor, sombra de ojos, crema de cuerpos, antiarrugas, anteojeras, perfumen es. Areopaquita ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago  en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovechar la temporada y los encargos que sus clientes le han realizado y de dicha forma darle respuesta a sus clientes. Areopaquita agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en: Areopaquita is 63, single, has no children, she is from the department of Leon located in the west of the country.  Aeropaquita's activity for 34 years has been the sale of cosmetics, her business consists of selling cosmetics, she sells them both at cash and credit conditions, products such as lipstick, eyeliner, blush, eyeshadow, body lotion, anti wrinkle cream, anti eye circle cream, perfume.  Aeropaquita has worked with the foundation before and has shown her responsibility with the payments in time and form.  The credit requested is to stock her business and take advantage of the season and fill orders from her clients and this way respond to them with good service.  Aeropaquita is thankful for the help the Kiva lenders provide to people with low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua this way they can have a dignified way of living.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, eyeliner, blush, eyeshadow, body lotion, anti wrinkle cream, anti eye circle cream, perfume.

loans.name: Samato

texts.en:
For the past two years, Samato has sold Masai clothing and jewelry at the Bissil market, with a monthly income of 22,500 KES. 

Samato is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to purchase more Masai clothing and jewelry to sell. This will be her third loan with KADET LTD. Samato has got very good history with KADET LTD and she paid back her previous loans well and in good time.

Samato plans to use the profits from her loan to expand her business and open a boutique selling Masai-ware. In the future, she hopes to own a big store selling Masai clothing and souvenirs to tourists.

loans.use: to buy Masai clothing and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 44 years old married and to Kennedy, who contributes to the family income. She has been running her mobile transfer shop for a period of about two years with an income of approximately 14,320 KES a month.

This is her fifth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan to renovate her business premises for better customer service. 

She hopes to grow her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
Shaker is a 24-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son who is one year old.

Shaker wants to start his new project, which is a store for fun games from internet games to pool. Shaker is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of repairing the store such as painting, installing tiles and appropriate lighting, and also purchasing one pool table. Taking this loan will enable Shaker to prepare well for starting his business, which will be profitable and the only source of income to him, so he could offer better living conditions to his family.

Shaker is photographed next to his store.

loans.use: To repair the store and buy some requirements

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in the Tsalka district with her family - her husband and 4 children (17,15,11 and 5 years old). Eliso’s husband works as a security guard in private company. She works as a tutor assistant at the local kindergarten. Both of them get a monthly salary. The family is also involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have 5 milk cows, 3 calves, and a pig. Eliso milks cows and produces cheese and Sulguni (Georgian pickled cheese), which are sold in the capital city. Eliso has a rich experience in her work. 

Eliso requested a loan to purchase hay to feed the cows during the fall and winter seasons. She planned to sell a cow for buying food for the cattle, but preferred to get a loan so she is able to keep her livestock. Hay is cheap now, but the price increases by 30% to 40% in the winter months. She can significantly save on the costs of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family. The income of the family will increase accordingly. Thus, Eliso will be able to increase her agricultural business and improve living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase hay for feeding the cattle.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El Comité " San Roque", es un comité con 11 integrantes se encuentran en el tercer ciclo. Todas son mujeres trabajadoras y humildes, el  comité está situado en la Ciudad de Curuguaty.
Están renovando con el compromiso de continuar con la responsabilidad de siempre y trabajar en conjunto para salir adelante, además mejorar el ingreso de la familia. Una de ellas es Digna, quien tiene una despensa y solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser yerba, arroz, aceite, leche y demás.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Roque" has 11 members, and they are in their 3rd loan cycle.  All of them are hardworking and humble women.  This communal bank is located in the city of Curuguaty.

They are renewing their commitment to being responsible and working together to get ahead.  Also, they are committed to increasing their household incomes.  One of the members is Digna, who has a store and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of products for her store, such as tea, rice, cooking oil, milk, and other products.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of four children and all of her children go to school. She has business of selling green bananas. She does not have to support additional family members other than her children.

Susan has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Susan aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Airport, Liberia. She is 45 years old and has a 6th grade education; she has two children, ages 19 and 23, who are in school and live at home. 

For 12 years, Lucy has been selling rubber dishes (such as plates, cups, bowls, and spoons) in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her sale. Her customers respond well to her business, and her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Gauri

texts.en:
Gauri is 50 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 30 and 26. In 2008, Gauri established her grocery store business, and she supports her family by working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day. In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of pasal use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By purchasing inventory in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profits. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

Gauri has already received and successfully repaid one loan from BPW Patan, which she also used to buy groceries for her pasal. In the future, Gauri plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale.

loans.name: Tupie

texts.en:
Tupie is 45 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married, and her husband is a social worker.  They have three children between the ages of 19 and 22, all of them attending school and living at home. 

For the past 22 years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business, She plans to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en:
Namiq is 29 years old and married, with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds sheep and cattle and additionally sells milk products and meat. Namiq has more than six years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle. 

Namiq usually buys lambs, which he raises and fattens in three to six months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat-selling bring AZN 150 income per month. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in such everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered as very healthy, and they are also present in everyday life.   

There is only one financial income in his family, and it's not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved children. Namiq applied for a loan of AZN 2000 to purchase 20 sheep, one cow, and fodder. This will be his third loan, and he is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep, a cow, and fodder.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta lives in Airport, Liberia. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have 6 children between 5 and 22 years old, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. 

For the past 15 years, Satta has been running a cook shop, a restaurant where she makes a good living selling Liberian food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies (such as oil, pepper, onion, butter, and salt) for her restaurant. In the future, she plans to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with seven children, all of whom go to school. Annet and her family reside in a rented house and have access to electricity and piped water. Annet has a business selling cold drinks, and she also generates additional income selling charcoal. She retails cold drinks and charcoal to a variety of customers and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters, and her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

Annet has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy supplies for her business, including bags of passion fruits, oranges, mangoes, and pineapples, sugar, boxes of mineral water, and crates of soda. Annet is an aspiring wholesaler, and she also wants to build rooms for rent.

loans.use: to buy more passion frits,oranges,mangoes,pineapples sugar and boxes of mineral water and crates of soda

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Glady lives in Buchanan, along with her husband and their four children between the ages of 2 and 21; they have children in school.

For the past five years she has been selling fish in the market.  She started this business with a little money that she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business.  Her plans are to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Gioconda Isabel

texts.es:
Gioconda, de 39 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 16 años, quien estudia su cuarto años de la secundaria, ambos viven en la ciudad de Managua. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida especialmente desayunos y almuerzos además de atender una pulpería. 
Inicio su negocio a la edad de 35 años comenzó vendiendo comida porque las personas que trabajan frente a su casa le pedían y le preguntaban por comida así que decidió invertir en el negocio de comidas a domicilio. Poco tiempo después comenzó su negocio de pulpería pues la personas que se acercaban a su negocio buscaban productos que son de mucho uso y consumos en los hogares y los negocios de pulperías son muy escasos en esa zona por lo cual ahora tiene su pulpería la cual le ayuda su único hijos atenderla y ella con el negocio de la comida.  
Esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos de limpieza, avenas, enlatados, sopas. Esto le permitirá tener más inventario de productos que son de alto consumo en su pulpería. Una de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y la de su hogar.
texts.en:
Gioconda, who is 39 years old, is a single mother. She has a 16-year-old son, who is in his fourth year of secondary school. Both live in the city of Managua. Her work is selling food, especially breakfasts and lunches, in addition to tending a grocery store.

She began her business at the age of 35. She began selling food because the people who worked across the street from her house asked her for food and inquired about it, and so she decided to invest in a food business at home.  A short time afterwards, she began her grocery store business, since the people who came to her business were looking for products that are highly used in homes, and grocery store businesses are very scarce in this area. For this reason, she now has her grocery store, which her only son helps her tend, and she works in the food business.

She needs financing to buy soft drinks, rice, oil, cleaning products, oats, canned goods, and soups. This will allow her to have more inventory of products that are highly sold in her grocery store. One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of her business and that of her home.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, oil, cleaning products, oats, canned goods and soups for her store.

loans.name: Lawrena

texts.en:
Lawrena is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia. She is married and has a high school education. She has four children between the ages of 18 and 26 who live with her at home and attend school.

For the past five years, Lawrena has been selling slippers in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers, and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for sale.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
En el Barrio San Roque de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, se formo un comité que actualmente están en el 7mo. Ciclo son 18 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras  trabajadoras y responsables con un espíritu solidario con muchos deseos de superación.
Un ejemplo claro del grupo es Lucila quien es madre de familia que sustenta a 6 hijos con su trabajo diario de ventas de comestibles, frutas y verduras ella quiso que sus vecinas se unieran en grupo. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras y así poder surtirse.
texts.en:
A communal bank was formed in the San Roque neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú, and it is now in its 7th loan cycle. There are 18 members. It is a group of hard-working and responsible women who have a united spirit and much desire to excel.

One clear example of the group is Lucila, who is the mother of a family and feeds six children with her daily work of selling foodstuffs, fruits, and vegetables. She wants her neighbors to form a group. She is applying for the loan to buy fruits and vegetables and thus be able to restock.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer joven con 21 años de edad, casada y madre de una niña de dos años. Esforzada y trabajadora, lucha por conseguir lo que se propone. Se dió cuenta de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de volantes. Se dedica al comercio de ventas por catálogo de varias casas comerciales. Inició su actividad con la finalidad de superarse, independizarse y ayudarse a pagar sus estudios universitarios. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para las ventas y cobros de la mercadería. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y trabajadores de diferentes empresas de la comunidad.
texts.en: María is a young woman at 21 years old, married, has a two year old daughter. Energetic and hardworker, she fights to achieve what she wants.  She became aware of the services of Fundacion Mujer through a flyer.  She works selling products through catalogs from different companies.  She started this activity hoping to get ahead, become independent and help herself with university studies.  She has the support of her husband for collection and sales of the merchandise.  Her customers are neighbors, family and workers of different companies in the community.

loans.use: to buy catalog products for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia  de 58 anos de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad de 46, 42,38 anos. Cecilia es originaria del  municipio de Malpaisillo, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. La actividad económica de Cecilia es el destace de cerdos y venta de productos lácteos hace 22 anos que se dedica a esta actividad. Actividad que consisten en vender cerdos en pie y el destace del mismo y ofrecer la carne del cerdo a las personas que elaboran comida con la carne del mismo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El cual inicio para tener una fuente de trabajo y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar un lote de cerdos y estar abastecida para darles respuesta a sus clientes. Ella agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener una fuente de trabajo digna.
texts.en: Cecilia is 58 years old. She is a single mother with three adult children, ages 46, 42, and 38. Cecilia is originally from the community of Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. Her business is butchering pigs and selling milk products. She has worked in this business for 22 years. Her business consists of buying live pigs, butchering them, and offering the meat to people who prepare food using the meat. Her business is located in her home. She began it in order to have a source of employment and to help with the household expenses. She needs the financing to buy a batch of pigs and be stocked to respond to her customers. She is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, to have a source of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business by buying a batch of pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Mbuyae Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Activas Mbayue” se formó con la unión de varias señoras de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, se unieron con el objetivo de sentirse útiles a sí mismas y a sus familias, para superarse personalmente y luchar contra la pobreza.
Teodora es miembro del grupo, ella vende chipa, el cual es un alimento típico paraguayo. Ella  solicita de este crédito para la compra de harina, manteca, huevos, grasa y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus chipas y venderlas.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
The loan group “Mujeres Activas Mbayue,” or “Active Women of Mbayue,” was formed with the coming together of several women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They got together with the goal of feeling useful for themselves and for their family in order to improve themselves and fight against poverty. 

Teodora is one member of the group. She sells chipa, a typical food of Paraguay [a kind of bread usually made with cassava or corn flour]. She is requesting the loan to purchase flour, butter, eggs, fat, and other ingredients to be able continue making and selling the chipa. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving since it will be very helpful.

loans.use: purchase flour, butter, eggs, cooking fat, and other ingredients for making 'chipa'

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2008, se encuentran  en el 18º ciclo. Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Celia, ella tiene un local comercial donde vende prendas de todo tipo en la ciudad de Encarnación.
La Sra. Celia  solicita el crédito para utilizarlo en  la compra de ropas.  Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a la ayuda de la fundación y de su grupo está pudiendo crecer.
texts.en:
This group was formed through promotion made in the area, they work with the foundation since 2008, they are going through their 18th cycle.  One of the members of the group is Celia who has a commercial stand where she sells all types of clothing in the city of Encarnacion.  
Celia requests a loan to buy clothing.  She is very thankful because thanks to the help from the foundation and from her group she has been able to grow.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Yadulla

texts.en:
Yadulla is a 49-year-old married man and has four children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person), and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle, and he sells dairy products, as well as cattle for beef to local butchers. Yadulla has more than 12 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best way to look after cattle. 

Yadulla usually buys calves, raises and fattens them in five to six months, and resells them from his house, for a profitable price, to butchers. Milk and yogurt he sells to the neighbors. Selling dairy products and meat brings 80 AZN per month in income. Milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

Yadulla's is the only income in his family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Yadulla applied for a loan of 1750 AZN to purchase three beef cattle, one milking cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy three beef cattle, one milking cow, and fodder.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 23 years old and lives with his parents and his wife. He sells clothing in the center of the capital city, and has rented a commercial store since last year. David is always friendly with his customers and tries to offer them the items they need. In addition, he has his own car and works as a taxi driver when he has free time. He is young, but he does his best for his family.

David is requesting a loan for purchasing piglets. He will raise and fatten them, and then sell them at a good price to gain income. Generating a good profit, this will allow him to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en: José Antonio’s small family farm has become a problem for his neighbors, due to the odor and flies resulting from hog waste. He will use his 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to treat the waste, allowing him to continue his family’s traditional way of life despite the urbanization of his town. Besides reducing odor and flies, his new biodigester will produce renewable biogas and organic fertilizer, displacing non-renewable LP gas and petroleum-intensive agrochemical fertilizer use on his property. This Kiva loan is for 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients in order to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married lady aged 29 years old. She is blessed with two children aged five and two years old. She operates a green grocery stall in the Majengo area of Narok. She has been running the business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She borrowed her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to expand her busy stall by buying variety of fruits and vegetables for sale.
 
The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to expand her green grocery stall.

loans.name: Yorleni

texts.es: Doña Yorleni es una señora de 43 años, casada, tiene tres hijos. Humilde, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación tanto personal como familiar. Ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo a la Fundación. La señora se dedica al comercio de ventas por catálogo tres años. Vió la necesidad de ayudar económicamente a su esposo, por lo que se afilió a dos casas comerciales de catálogos. Ella sale a vender y cobrar sin descuidar a su familia. Tiene el apoyo de una hija adolescente en los oficios domésticos y de su esposo para entregar y cobrar sus pedidos. Su meta es aumentar sus ventas para obtener más ingresos y ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos,a su esposo a reparar su casa de habitación, ya que no está en las mejores condiciones por las inundaciones que han habido en los últimos años. Éste financiamiento me ayudará a crecer y superarme.
texts.en:
Yorleni is a married 43 year old mother of three. She is hardworking and humble, and she has a great desire to better herself and help her family. She lives with her husband and three kids. This is the second time she has requested a loan from the foundation. 

Yorleni has worked selling out of catalogs for three years. She saw the need to help her husband financially, so she started working with two catalog companies. She goes out to sell and collect money without neglecting her family. Her teenage daughter helps her with the housework, and her husband helps with delivering and charging for the goods. Her goal is to increase her sales in order to earn more of an income and be able to help her children with their education. She also wants to help her husband repair their house because it isn’t in the best condition right now due to the flooding that has happened in the past years. She says the loan will help her grow and better herself.

loans.use: invest in catalog merchandise.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 28 years old and is married with one child. He owns a business selling various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, etc. He has three years of experience. His business is open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day except on Sunday each week. Vedaste currently employs two people to help him. 

Vedaste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, etc., for resale. Through this expansion, Vedaste will be able to earn more profit which will be used to expand his general store, save for his future, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, toothpaste, etc., for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town, used his previous loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. It was profitable and he was able to pay back all the loan amount.

This is his third loan term. He plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs. These include seeds, fertilizer and farm chemicals. He will also use part of it for labor expenses. He anticipates making more profit, with which he will pay school fees for his children.

David hopes to expand his farming business by planting more cash crops, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and farm chemicals.

loans.name: Ngaza

texts.en: Ngaza is taking out a new loan so as to invest in her new business. She now sells cereals in a small store. She is grateful for the previous loan that helped her buy firewood. Ngaza is determined to move forward and have a prosperous life. She will buy 25 sacks of dry maize. She hopes to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: buy 25 sacks of dry maize.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.en: Maria Luisa, a farmer in the Tlaxcala high plains, is constantly looking to save time and money. A single mother with three daughters, Maria Luisa wants to improve her farming operation, so her daughters can have more time for their studies. With their new 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, the family will save money and the time they previously spent collecting firewood.  They will decrease their consumption of expensive, non-renewable LP gas. Additionally, the potent organic fertilizer produced by the biodigester will replace all of the agrochemical fertilizers they have been using. This Kiva loan represents 29% of the total cost of Maria Luisa's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 37 years old and lives in Airport, Liberia. She stopped her education at 2nd grade. She is married and has three children between 11 and 20 years old that are in school and live at home. She received money from her husband to start her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, peppers and charcoal for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, peppers and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 38 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband Gabriel is employed and supports the family with the additional income.

She sells flowers and plastic household items in Utawala estate, a business she has done for five years.She has applied for a business loan and plans to buy more flowers and plastic household goods for sale.

Tabitha will use the anticipated income to expand her business and be able to open another shop in future.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and plastic household items for her business.

loans.name: Siah L.

texts.en:
Siah is 49 years old. She lives in Airport. She is married and has children between 20 and 35 years old who are all living on their own. She has been running a shop where she sells rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items. She has been selling for the past ten years.

A problem that she faces is that she has few commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items for the business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 44 years old and runs a retail shop in Naivasha town. He is married to Patricia who is a fishmonger and they have five school-going children.

This is his first loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy goods to sell in his retail shop. These include 4 sacks of sugar, flour, and cooking fat. He will use the generated income to plant potatoes, onions and wheat on his farm.

John hopes to grow his business and make more income, and hence be able to educate his children to college level as well as provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Mwaboya

texts.en: Mwaboya is a determined mother who has been selling cereals for several years. She has gained good business experience. She is currently taking out a new loan so as to buy an overlock machine and a zig-zag machine for her tailoring business. Since the last loan, her living standards have greatly improved. Mwaboya is a woman of high integrity.

loans.use: to buy an over-ock machine and a zig-zag machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred sells clothes in Naivasha town and has been in the business for three years. He is 34 years old and is married to Leah who is a farmer. They have two children aged five and one years old.

This being his first loan term KADET LTD, he plans to use the amount to buy more clothes to sell in his business. He will use the generated profits from his business to rent a stall in the marketplace and sell more variety of clothes.

In the future, Alfred hopes to expand his business by selling clothes to various towns in the region.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: In addition to her charcoal-selling business, Chizi has been able to open a tailoring business. She is so grateful for the support she is getting from Yehu and Kiva. Chizi narrates that since the previous loan, her monthly income has very much increased. Her dream is to open a tailoring and dressmaking training unit. She is requesting this loan that will be used to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ummi

texts.en:
Ummi, 26, lives with her life companion and two children in her own house. She sells sells juice and charcoal from her home. She is a visionary woman who wants to get ahead. She also sells ladies' shoes. She’s been in business for four years and has gained much sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits. She has acquired a large clientele that prefers her because of the quality, good prices, and above all excellent service. The loan she is asking will enable her buy a freezer and sacks of charcoal.

Ummi is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who very much wants to get ahead. She has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures that she’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time has faith that she’ll provide economic security for her home.

loans.use: buy a freezer and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children go to school. She takes care of no additional family members. She operates a retail shop from a market. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 13 years. She works six days a week.

She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, crates of soda, and other soft drinks. Her major business challenges are ever-increasing prices of commodities and seasonality.

Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a wholesale shop and also to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, flour, rice, crates of soda, and other soft drinks.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Gorreth is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from operating a saloon.

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy passionfruit, tomatoes, green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to increase her capital basis and become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: to buy more passionfruit, green bananas, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 37 years old, lives in Airport, and stopped her education at 1st grade. She has three children between 2 and 17 years old that are in school and live at home. For the past twenty years she has been selling rice and rubber dishes (cups, bowls, spoons) in the local market. She received money from her husband to start her business. She enjoys her business because it helps to sustain her and her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and rubber dishes for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like soap, sugar and snack foods for her general store business.

Fe has been in this business for eight years. Fe earns additional income from basket weaving.
